content.description: This is one of the few trad routes in the area.  Your Possible Pasts is located on the wall opposite of the Top Rope area.  The route climbs an obvious serpantine crack past a small bush and to the top of the wall.  The route is fun, protects well, and would be superb if it was only a little longer.  As it was, it was a very enjoyable climb.  The only tricky part is the start, but easy climbing quickly gets you to the crack and to protection.  Belay on top and walk off down and to the left (heads out around the point of Long Wall).  Fun, too bad it's so short.
content.protection: Small cams (to about 2") and a set of stoppers.

content.description: This route offers face climbing on jugs and has a small roof at the start and a more interesting finish. There is fine climbing on good holds throughout. I can't really assess the grade accurately. It's somewhere in the 5.7-5.9 range.
content.location:
This is a bolted line just right of "

Your Possible Pasts

". There is a bolted anchor at the top that can be easily reached from the latter route for a descent.

content.description:
This is kind of dirty, but it is fun if you're waiting to get on

Edge of Time

.  The guidebook has this listed as Unknown 5.8.
content.protection: [4] bolts and 2 for anchors. Bring gear for between the 1st and 2nd bolt, since this is the crux, and if you blow the 2nd clip, you're probably going to hit the ground. I placed a #3 C4, but the horizontal will take larger or smaller depending on where you place it.
content.location:
This is just left of "

Another Brick in the Wall

" and the only bolted route on the Long Wall.

content.description:
This is a trad line about 20 feet or so to the left of

Your Possible Pasts

.  It is barely fun but only if you've been there and want to climb something else.  It's best probably not to consider a route to whip upon.  It might be on the lean side of a star.

The crux is probably after the 2nd horizontal.  Walkoff to the North.

Pink Floyd, eh?
content.protection:
Some cams, #0.5 to #3 Camalot, for the horizontals, and something trad for the anchors.

Per

James Schroeder

: this route has been retrobolted with 5 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is on the West face of Long Wall, about 20 feet left of the obvious crack.
